results.title: The Black Cannon incident
results.brief_description: This daring political comedy caused a huge controversy on release in China and was banned from export for two years. An inoffensive engineer comes under suspicion of industrial espionage when he sends a personal telegram which makes a cryptic mention of a Black Cannon. The Security Bureau finds some “worrying” data in his personal file, for example he was raised as a catholic. An investigation is launched and the resulting chaos provides the basis of a tragi-comedy narrative in which the Chinese ruling class is daringly satirised. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: The Belly of an Architect
results.brief_description: This is the story of a distinguished American architect, Stanley Kracklite, who goes to Rome’s Museum and Mausoleum of Western Art, to put on an exhibition in memory of his hero, the 18th century visionary, French architect, Etienne Louis Boullee. Kracklite becomes more and more preoccupied with his work and obsessed with his health, and in doing so alienates his wife. The visual style of the film aims for a continual background of architecture to indicate that man is persistently lost in its shadow.

results.title: Red sorghum
results.brief_description: Set in the barren wilderness of Northern China, this is the simple story of how an offscreen narrator’s grandparents met and fell in love. A young village girl is married off to a rich and elderly leper. He is mysteriously murdered not long after the wedding and she takes on the management of his distillery with the help of the labourers. A relationship develops between herself and the sedan carrier who has saved her life. All appears to be going well until the advent of the Sino-Japanese war and the chilling appearance of the foreign invaders. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Mr Horatio Knibbles
results.creator_credit: Robert Hird, Hugh Stewart and Anvil Films
results.brief_description: Mr. Horatio Knibbles is a magic rabbit that only Mary Bunting can see. Mary’s mother’s jewellery goes missing but with the help of Mr. Knibbles and his friends, Squirrel Postman, Air Mail Pigeon and Mrs. Magpie, the real culprit is found. A live action fantasy. Cast includes Anthony Shepard as Horatio Knibbles, Lesley Roach, Gary Smith, Rachel Brennock, John Ash, Nigel Chivers. From an original story by Wallace Bosco.

results.title: Sky pirates
results.creator_credit: C M Pennington-Richards, Frank Godwin and Ansus Films
results.brief_description: When their model plane crashes at the Aero Club, Mike and Harry are befriended by ex-pilot, Charlie Bradford, and his niece, Maggie, who teach them to fly radio controlled planes. Charlie invites them to the test flight of his new long distance aircraft which is later stolen. When they learn that a diamond has been stolen from the French State Museum, they realise the plane is to be used to smuggle the diamond out of the country.

results.title: Blue fin
results.creator_credit: Carl Schultz, Hal McElroy and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Colin Thiele, this is a heartwarming story of a boy growing to maturity. Pascoe expects too much of his young son Snook, who always seems to be in trouble. Disaster strikes their boat Blue Fin at sea and young Snook is the only person left who can save them. The boat is wrecked and sinking. Pascoe lies injured, his crew swept overboard. The waves are mountainous … can Snook save his father and the Blue Fin? Rated: G.

results.title: Black Beauty
results.creator_credit: James Hill, Tony Tenser, Chilton Film Productions and Tigon Pictures
results.brief_description: Adapted by Wolf Mankowitz from the classic children’s book by Anna Sewell, Black Beauty tells the story of a luckless horse who is passed from hand to hand but is finally restored to its original young master and has a happy retirement. Stars Mark Lester, Walter Slezak and Patrick Mower.

results.title: Treasure Island
results.creator_credit: Byron Haskin, Perce Pearce and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: A rousing, live-action adventure, based on Robert Louis Stevenson’s classic story. Young Jim Hawkins possesses a map of Treasure Island, and sets sail with a ship full of gold seekers. However, Long John Silver, a greedy crewman, quickly masterminds a mutiny, then gathers a ragged band of pirates to resume the treasure hunt…with young Hawkins as their unwilling and terrified hostage. Stars Robert Newton and Bobby Driscoll.

results.title: The Sword in the Stone
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Reitherman and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: A wondrous golden sword embedded in a large stone offers a tempting challenge to the strongest and bravest men in the kingdom - remove the sword and become the next king of England! When one small boy dares to accept the challenge, he unleashes a series of awesome miracles and incredible battles between the wizards in England. With glorious animation and delightful songs, this story is a Walt Disney classic.

results.title: The Neverending Story
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Petersen, Dieter Geissler and Bernard Eichinger
results.brief_description: A young boy escapes the neighbourhood bullies by retreating into a mysterious book that takes him into a shimmering fantasy world of creatures, giant forests and massive oceans. It is an awesome world, but a world in decay, and its existence is being threatened. Rated: G
